meanings.definition: Relating to the physical production of speech sounds.
meanings.sent1: The articulatory process involves the movements needed to make different sounds.
meanings.sent2: She studied articulatory phonetics to understand how sounds are made.
meanings.sent3: The articulatory dance of the lips and tongue amused the children in the speech therapy class.
meanings.sent4: His articulatory skills were like a well-choreographed ballet of speech.
meanings.sent5: The articulatory details of pronunciation can be tricky to master.

meanings.definition: Involving the movement of the articulatory organs in speech production.
meanings.sent1: The articulatory gestures of the mouth and throat are crucial for clear speech.
meanings.sent2: During the articulatory process, the tongue moves to form different sounds.
meanings.sent3: The articulatory acrobatics required for beatboxing impressed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her articulatory control was as precise as a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The articulatory complexity of human speech is fascinating to study.
